I used to be like you! I hated picks and I did everything either fingerpicked or just strumming with my hand because picks didn't feel comfortable and I got to be a pretty good finger picker, but I wanted to work on my lead playing so I forced myself to use a pick and in the past year my playing has improved more than it has in the past five years combined. I can not only do most of the things I used to do with finger picking using hybrid picking or by using strumming patterns and muting techniques I can do cooler stuff than I ever thought I could do all because I MADE myself use a pick. Don't get me wrong I still like playing fingersyle, it makes me feel really connected to my instrument, but playing with slick is like a muscle you have to exercise and eventually it becomes second nature. Expanding beyond your comfort zone is an opportunity to learn something new as long as you aren't hurting yourself To each their own though, tons of great players only used their fingers and were way more successful than I am, so do what you want:)

It's like I have one set of thoughts that are normal and sound like me and make sense, and I have one or two more voices that are angry, don't sound like me, and don't make sense at all. They can range from sinister whispers that are easier to ignore to the loudest, most angry shouting that I can't block out. On a good day I either don't hear any voices but my own, or a few whispers with an occasional shout, but on a bad day the whispers are constant and build to shouts until I can calm myself down.

This sounds like my brother, who we didn't think inherited the family anxiety gene until we slowly realized his anxiety stemmed from smells that he didn't like If he is around a grill for two seconds he had to run in and shower, even if no one else thinks he smells like smoke, he smells it, and he needs it to be gone
I haven't heard of these programs... Do you have any more info about them that you could share with me or anyone else that doesn't know? Please

Thank you so much
I'm sorry... I feel like I was just way too hostile with you I don't mean to be that way...
Yea, but we're going to more doctors just to make sure Why do you ask?
We are currently looking for more opinions and I'm hoping it's not a correct diagnosis but still knowing that it's something bad doesn't help
Thanks so much You've really made this seem smaller
It's no problem It makes me feel better if I know I helped others I like helping others and I care about others, I just don't want that side of me to slip away
Thank you for sharing with me That information helps

I was getting more and more paranoid about people coming to take me away, the voices in my head telling me awful things were getting louder and more hateful, the urges that I felt were getting more violent and harder to control, I was reacting emotionally to things the wrong way, and getting really hostile towards people for no reason.
Thank you for the kind words It makes me a little less scared to know that I'm only 20 and I feel like I am being deprived of something

Well I had always thought that there was something more wrong with me than just general anxiety disorder but I always hid it so that people would think I was normal and I thought I could control it It been getting worse and worse and my fianc (who ironically has a degree in psychology) started to notice and she asked me about it and I finally told her and she told me what she thought it was and we went to a doctor and found out she was right

WRITING.TITLE: I'm sad and need help/advice
WRITING.TEXT: Hey trees... I've been lurking here for a good while and you've always been good to me. Now I'm in a bit of trouble. It's not super serious but I just moved to a new town (not gonna say where) and it's fantastic other than one thing... I use bud to help with my near crippling anxiety and now I don't know anyone around here, much less anyone to sell to me, and my anxiety is getting really bad again. How do you find a new dealer in a new city without being sketchy or seeming like a narc? I'm not asking anyone here to sell to me or if they know anyone because I know it's not allowed, but I can't find anyone... I'm sinking pretty fast
"Quit being smart... It's not cool. Like your pops"
My mom found out It wasn't too bad Our terms now are that I make sure she is never ever aware of it again haha

I don't want to rain on the parade here but... I quit my job without a backup for the same reasons and I ended up homeless and jobless for about 6 months. It very well might be okay but you have to realize it might not be as well. My anxiety was worse during my job search. I had no money, no food, and no where to stay. I understand your anxiety is telling you to flee but it may not be the best thing for you
